The rear lights and outline of this vehicle are distinctly visible, indicating its immobility. This particular vehicle serves as an immediate obstacle, necessitating that the ego vehicle must either remain stopped or find a safe and feasible way to maneuver around it.

In addition to the stationary vehicle, there is a traffic light in the vicinity. Given this uncertainty, the ego car is advised to stay put and adhere to the standard traffic regulations until the signal state becomes clear, ensuring safe proceed.

Surrounding environmental cues corroborate the presence of a construction zone or road works, as evidenced by fenced barriers on both sides of the road. These barriers not only denote a reduction in road width but also signal drivers to exercise increased caution while navigating this area.

Moreover, visible construction debris along the roadside further reinforces the notion of recent or ongoing construction activities, suggesting a heightened level of vigilance is necessary. The presence of debris could indicate the likelihood of encountering workers in close proximity or encountering rapidly changing road conditions, both of which demand a cautious approach from all road users.

In this setting, certain categories like vulnerable road users, traffic signs, traffic cones, and other potential obstacles are notably absent, indicating a relatively controlled but obstructed road segment primarily dominated by construction activities and necessitating careful navigation.
